intro: Isachne wombaliensis, commonly known as the Wombali sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or wetlands. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
